title: Apprentice star Claude Littner admitted to hospital to undergo back surgery
text:

Star of The Apprentice Claude Littner has revealed that he is taking time out of his hectic schedule to undergo an operation on his back.

The business mogul, 70, broke the news on Twitter on Tuesday, the night before the next episode of Lord Sugar's business series returns to BBC One.

Fans were immediately concerned Claude wouldn't make it out of hospital in time for the show.

But Claude had fun reminding them that the programme does not actually go out live at 9pm.

(Image: PA)

"My back is 'killing me'. As a matter of fact, I am having a back operation on Wednesday," he first told his followers.

"Will he be alright for the show tomorrow night?" a worried follower replied, CCing in Lord Sugar.

Claude sassily typed back:" The phone will ring, it is Lord Sugar's office. I will have just 20 minutes to shower, shave, brush teeth, get dressed, pack my clothes for the hospital stay, review my emails, and run to the people carrier. After the op, I will dash to the boardroom arriving before deadline!"

"You can't have a back op on Wednesday you're on telly ;)" said another of Claude's fans.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: BBC/Boundless)

"My operation is tomorrow morning. The Apprentice is on at 9pm. What is the problem?" Claude replied.

He appeared to be in a mischievous mood, despite his impending to trip to theatre, as he also teased: "Doctor did say he had never done a back operations, BUT he was willing to 'give it a go'! In true Apprentice task style, I found that showed initiative & was very encouraging!! (Only joking)."

Claude has been a familiar face on the BBC business show since 2015, when he replaced Nick Hewer as one of Lord Sugar's aides.

(Image: BBC/Boundless)

(Image: BBC)

He joins Karen Brady in keeping a close eye over the contestants as they try to win a series of challenges.

Claude and Karen have their work cut out for the 15th series of the show as many viewers have called the hopefuls the worst bunch ever.

In tonight's episode the remaining stars are tasked with brainstorming a new toy and creating an advert to promote it.

Find out who gets fired tonight at 9pm on BBC One.
description: The mogul is receiving treatment on the same day the the BBC business shows goes to air
